channel.title: Posts on Charleen Ta
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Charleen Ta

item.title: Basic RegEx
item.description: RegEx is one of the most useful parts of Python in my opinion and as a biochemistry major, it is very handy for manipulating DNA sequences. Using reticulate to combine both R and Python, we can see that the RegEx can find instances of a sequence in a longer sequence and this can be helpful to locate the sequences digested by restiction enzymes. library(reticulate) import re string5="" re.findall(r"A[ATCG]TAAT|GC[AG][AT]TG", string5) ## ['GCGTTG', 'ATTAAT', 'GCAATG', 'ACTAAT']

item.title: Some other cool projects
item.description: One of the classes that I really enjoyed here at UT was CS324E which is Elements of Graphics and Visualization. We created a lot of cool graphics and animations projects and even made games. This first one was my final project and definitely my favorite. We made a game to catch all of Santaâ€™s Lost Presents! You can find the demo video here! Some other examples include a physics-based animation which can be viewed here and a very basic animation which can be viewed here.

item.title: Just a little more about me...
item.description: Hello! I am currently a senior here at the University of Texas at Austin and plan to graduate in May 2021. I am originally from Dallas, TX and moved to Austin for school. After my years at UT, I hope to go into the medical field but for now I currently enjoy the jobs I have including teaching as a undergraduate TA and tutor and working with a doctor as a clinical assistant.
